title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
NOTE: On the AP Exam, to earn a point for a rubric row, responses will need to meet all criteria for that row.

Points earned:

+1 [Skill 3.A] The response includes a code segment that shows an assignment being made to the variable.

+1 [Skill 3.A] The response includes a code segment that shows how the variable is being used as part of fulfilling the program’s purpose.

Do NOT award a point if:

● The use of the variable is trivial and does not assist in fulfilling the program’s purpose.

+1 [Skill 3.A] The response identifies the name of the variable being used in this response.

+1 [Skill 4.B] The response describes what the data contained in the variable represents in the program.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the written response does not name the selected variable.

● the description does not apply to the selected variable.

+1 [Skill 3.C] The response explains how the selected variable manages complexity in the program code by explaining why this program code could not be written, or how it would be written differently without using this variable.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the written response does not name the selected variable.

● the solution without the variable is implausible, inaccurate, or inconsistent with the program.
